text:
Sri Lanka targets 4m tourist arrivals by 2020
The Emerald Isle would be targeting four million tourist arrivals by 2020, said Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority Chairman, Paddy Vithana.
Speaking at the Future of Tourism Summit he said Sri Lanka might not be ready by that time to meet them. “We must understand our limitations in the human resources and rooms sector.”
He said that in addition to the anticipated 4 million visitors there would be a high number of Sri Lankan traveller too who would be travelling internally. “Hence we would need more rooms and additional infrastructure, specially at cultural sites to accommodate both local and foreign tourists.”
He also said travel trends were fast changing and today over 60% of bookings in Sri Lanka are online. “This summit would also help us to study emerging pattern of the industry and map out strategies accordingly.”
